content.question: Which of the following is an implication of the authorâ€™s argument for international trade between Western countries and oil-rich countries?

choices.label: Oil-rich countries should centralize control over natural resources to make oil production more efficient.
Oil-rich countries should nationalize oil resources to reduce political influence of foreign governments.
Western countries should promote direct investment and economic development in oil-rich countries.
